item.title: About me
item.description: Hi, I’m Jesse! ðŸ‘‹ (Some people know me as x30n) I’m a hacker - mostly interested in vulnerability research, reverse engineering, exploit development, and cryptography. I’ve been hacking things since I was a teenager (which explains my 1337 handle ðŸ˜‚) in the late ’90s - the golden age of hacking. I used to play a lot of CTFs. My team, Digital Revelation (or digrev), and I played regularly in DEF CON CTF for about seven years (we won twice!

item.title: Resurrection
item.description: Around the year 2000, I got my first always on (ADSL) internet connection at home. I was working as a sysadmin and programmer at the time for the high school I’d just graduated from (we actually provided technology services and operated a full fledged ISP for a number of other schools across California). Anyway, once I had stable internet access (with a static IP!) at home, I of course had to stake my claim on the internet.
